page.title: 01Arundel and the survey area.
page.content: The town of{Arundel}(Harundel in the original Domesday Book) lies on the {River Arun}at the southern edge of the {South Downs.}It is some 14km east of Chichester and 14km west of Worthing. The resorts of Littlehampton and Bognor Regis lie to the south and southwest respectively. It is famous for its{Castle}- the seat of the{Dukes {of Norfolk.}Her Grace Lavinia, Duchess of Norfolk is a very active figure in the life of the community. It is a noted{tourist attraction}with its castle, Wildfowl Trust, river and coutry park. Its Cathedral, dedicated to and containing the tomb of Saint Philip Howard attracts many pilgrims. A major part of the survey area is owned by the {Norfolk Estate}and is good{farmland}under lease to tenants. There are several small villages of mainly farming communities.
